content.description: The crux comes right off the ground. Make some thin moves on steep rock with poor feet to an in-cut jug at the 2nd clip. Make gym like moves on jugs till you are over the steep stuff. One more balancy move above the last clip leads to the anchor.
content.location: This is the farthest left bolt line. Look for (look out for) guano at the start.

content.description: Start your battle on the left side of the slab, way left of the tree. The crux is moving over the small overhang with bad feet right after the 2nd clip. Small edges and balance intensive footwork lead past the remaining two clips. This short, little climb is pretty fun and engaging but still a little dirty. Don't leave your pack open at the base or it will be showered with lichen.
content.location: This is the 2nd bolt line from the left. Start on the left edge of the face.

content.description: It is hard to clip the first bolt on this without making some risky moves.  The crux is between the first and second bolts but it is not easy, or safe, to get to the first bolt.  The slab above the first two bolts is fairly easy to ascend.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is just to the left of

Ellie May

on the right side of the rock.  There is a small overhang at the bottom.  It has 2 bolts at the top to use to get down.

content.description: This route is entertaining for how short it is.  The crux comes above the second bolt where you pull on small holds onto the slab above.  The climbing is much easier after you get over the crux bulge.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  There are no rings for lowering off the bolts at the top.  It could use some quicklinks.
content.location: This is the route furthest to the east (right side when facing the crag) on the crag.  It starts at a small overhang below a stance with a good jug from which the first bolt can be clipped.  This is the only place at the crag where the ground is somewhat flat at the start.  You descend from a two bolt anchor at the top.

content.description: This may be the easiest route, at 10d, at the crag. The first bolt is a little high but not too hard to clip.  The crux comes at about the third bolt, and the climbing is made easier by stemming in this section.  This would not be a good lead for novices whether they climb the grade or not.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is in a left-facing dihedral at about the center of the crag.  It is just to the right of a big tree in front of the crag.  You descend from a two bolt anchor at the top.
